intro: Odontites powellii, commonly known as Powell's toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Odontites powellii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various healing purposes.
